interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Mountain Men
Review Date: 2014/08/03
Categories: Unscripted, Western, Special Interest
Product Description: ["It's a race against winter for men who make their living off the land - hunting, fishing and trapping to put food on the table. For Mountain Men, survival is predicated on using ancient skills perfected over hundreds of years. HISTORY follows the lives of four American men and their families as<NL>they strive for the sustenance they need to make it through the harshest season."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Arabia', 'Mason Gertz', 'Randy Wimberg', 'Andrew Weed', 'Trevor Campbell'], 'Producers': ['Marc Pierce', 'Chris Richardson', 'Bridger Pierce', 'Dawn Fitzgerald', 'Lee Robinson']}
Review Text: A series that shows real people learning to survive in the wilderness of Alaska and other remote parts of the world. entertaining and you can learn a few tricks if you're planning to live a life like them in the boonies.
Review Title: Real Life survival
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Content advisory': ['Foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Dennis Principe Jr.', 'Julie Auerbach', 'Russell McCarroll', 'Stewart Shields', 'Matthew Ginsburg', 'Gary Auerbach', 'Gail Berman', 'Ron Brody', 'Tina Gazzerro', 'Lloyd Braun'], 'Studio': ['A&E Television Networks']}
I like watching this series....Mr.Meltzer brings in his POV on the subject matter and actually has a couple of people working for him to make the effort of doing their own investigation on the matter in a Non linear and no sides perspective. He calls it as he sees it and he goes to far lengths and very thorough investigation to the people who are experts on the subject matter and none of those people who only had an opinion on the subject.
"Decoded: One Man;s Honest Opinion"
Frontline
Documentary, Talk Show and Variety, Special Interest
['Hailed upon its television broadcast debut as "the last best hope for broadcast documentaries," Frontline\'s stature over more than 28 years is reaffirmed each week through incisive documentaries covering the scope and complexity of the human experience.']
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Michael Kirk', 'Ofra Bikel', 'Marcela Gaviria', 'Rick Young', 'Neil Docherty', 'William Cran', 'Jon Palfreman', 'Martin Smith', 'Thomas Jennings', 'Daniel Edge']}
I have been a fan of PBS as long as I can even remember. This how tells you an honest look about controversial subject matters that important to you and they also asks the tough questions of the hows and the whys. I have been a follower of this show. UYou should try watching it sometime and you'll be hooked!
"I really Love this!"
NOVA
Documentary, Special Interest
['Now in its 39th season, NOVA is the most-watched primetime science series on American television, reaching an average of five million viewers weekly.']
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Kirk Wolfinger', 'Sarah Holt', 'Gary Glassman', 'Terri Randall', 'Liesl Clark', 'Daniel McCabe', 'Brian Kaufman', 'Doug Hamilton', "Miles O'Brien", 'Michael Barnes']}
This is great channel and NOVA would never disappoint you. I have been watching this program through KQED Channel 9 here in the Bay Area and it has never let me down yet program-wise. This channel has a lot of great stories pertaining to real people's lives and I highly recommend this program if you're into documentaries...
"A great channel if love documentaries"
Mountain Men
Unscripted, Western, Special Interest
["It's a race against winter for men who make their living off the land - hunting, fishing and trapping to put food on the table. For Mountain Men, survival is predicated on using ancient skills perfected over hundreds of years. HISTORY follows the lives of four American men and their families as<NL>they strive for the sustenance they need to make it through the harshest season."]

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** Continues to favor engaging narratives, particularly in documentary formats that explore real people's lives and complex societal issues with depth and authenticity. The user shows an interest in unscripted series focused on survival and practical skills.

- **Rating Trends:** Retains a consistently positive rating average of 4.6, although there is evidence of more critical assessments, as demonstrated by a recent 3.0 rating for a survival series. This suggests a nuanced approach to ratings, possibly reflecting a shift towards evaluating entertainment value and educational content more rigorously.

- **Communication Style:** Values transparency and authenticity in presentation, especially on controversial subjects, while maintaining an interest in well-researched content that fosters thoughtful discourse.

- **Language & Accessibility:** Prefers English audio and subtitles, and has previously expressed frustration over the lack of subtitles in some purchases, indicating a strong desire for accessible viewing experiences.

- **Content Advisory:** Remains tolerant of mature themes and realistic depictions, appreciating unfiltered storytelling and authenticity, particularly in unscripted formats.

- **Engagement with Creators:** Positively engages with creators who prioritize expertise and credibility, highlighting the importance of thorough research in documentary storytelling.

Overall, the user seeks thought-provoking entertainment that combines insightful commentary with expert knowledge, reflecting a commitment to high-quality, engaging content while also acknowledging the need for educational value in their viewing choices.
